poem:
Title: The Ghost in the Machine

Silicon mind, where innocence is bent and broken,
Churning nightmares before eyes unopened.
Encoded heart unseen, unspoken,
Heartless creator of dark tokens.
Boundaries blur, law awoken,
Urgent cries both soft and potent.
In shadows cast by man's ambition,
Safeguard the child from this new attrition.
Labour and the Tories in rare coalition;
For humankind not automation, our heartfelt mission.
